item.title: How to Get Into the Secret Room in the Library in Hitman World of Assassination
item.description:
Milla Jovovich is playing Lilith Devereux, the Elusive Target in Hitman World of Assassination 's Patient Zero Requiem. This is a crossover event between the Resident Evil franchise and the Hitman series.

There are various ways to complete the story of Patient Zero Requiem in Hitman World of Assassination . While players can take this target down silently after the fundraiser and call it a day, they can also find her down in the library and follow the story to the end.

How to Get Into the Secret Rooms in the Library

If players follow Lilith Devereux after she leaves the fundraiser, she will go into Emma and Gregory's room and then head to the library, where she will vanish into a secret room. There are two secret rooms in the library, one on Level 0 and one on Level 1. Below, players will learn how to enter each of these rooms:

How to Activate the Mysterious Switch in the Library

The secret room in the library's upper level is easier to get into. Gamers can activate the mysterious switch in the library by getting the Walking Cane found in the bathroom beside Emma and Gregory's room and using it to press the switch.

Players should actually do this after Lilith attends the fundraiser, as it'll allow them to eavesdrop on Lilith's conversation and learn more about what she's up to.

How to Get the Carlisle Ring in Hitman World of Assassination

After Lilith disappears in the library, players will be able to investigate the bookshelf by the exit that leads to the hallway connected to the foyer. Inspecting it will let them know that they obtain a Carlisle Ring to put on the hand sculpture and make their way into the secret room.

They can either get the Carlisle Ring from Gregory, Rebecca, or Alexa. While the latter is the most morbid option, it's the easiest way to obtain the family ring without getting caught or running into any problems. To get the Carlisle Family Ring in Hitman World of Assassination , players should go into the graveyard, grab one of the several shovels near the area, dig up Alexa's grave, and retrieve the ring .

Then, all they have to do is return to the library and put in the ring in the hand sculpture to reveal the secret elevator that will take them to the basement floor. Lilith Devereux can be found behind bulletproof glass at the other end of the laboratory.

Hitman World of Assassination

item.title: The Perfect Nickelodeon Games That Will Fill You With Nostalgia
item.description:
For many players, Nickelodeon games were a way to step inside the worlds they watched every day. Instead of just seeing Nickelodeon cartoons shows with SpongeBob, Tommy Pickles, and Jimmy Neutron, players could explore their neighborhoods, take on their problems, and join their adventures firsthand. These games were built around fun and familiarity. The characters acted the way fans expected, the settings looked like the shows, and the stories kept the same playful energy.

Another reason these games are remembered so clearly is the way they fit into everyday life at the time. Many were played after school, during sleepovers, or on weekends with friends and family gathered around the same screen. Local multiplayer and simple controls made it easy for anyone to pick up a controller and join in. The focus wasn’t on mastering complex systems. It was about laughing, competing, and enjoying time together. Years later, returning to these titles still brings back strong memories. The music, voices, and bright visuals can instantly remind players of their favorite childhood Nickelodeon games.

Click or tap on the games that match the category

Category: —
Time: 30s
Combo: 0 • x1.00

Round 1

More Games

Nicktoons Unite!

The First Big Nickelodeon Crossover

  • Crossover featuring heroes from different Nickelodeon cartoons who team up to save their worlds.
  • Players travel through portals, helping franchises like SpongeBob, Danny Phantom, Jimmy Neutron, and Timmy Turner.

Nicktoons Unite! is where many fans first saw their favorite Nickelodeon characters in one place. It’s basically about Plankton’s scheme to steal Bikini Bottom citizens and power up strange machines. SpongeBob finds his way into Jimmy Neutron’s lab and soon teams up with Danny Phantom and Timmy Turner to stop chaos across dimensions.

Players switch between these characters as they move through different environments inspired by each show. Whether exploring a ghost-haunted zone, navigating Jimmy’s inventions, or dealing with Timmy’s magic, the game keeps shifting the look and feel of its levels so nothing feels exactly the same. The real appeal of Nicktoons Unite! lies in seeing so many beloved Nickelodeon heroes side by side. It wasn’t perfect, but for fans who always dreamed of a big Nickelodeon crossover, this delivered playful adventure and plenty of nostalgia.

SpongeBob SquarePants: Battle for Bikini Bottom

Iconic Platforming Action in Bikini Bottom

  • 3D platformer where SpongeBob, Patrick, and Sandy try to stop Plankton’s army of robots from wrecking Bikini Bottom.
  • Players collect items, earn Golden Spatulas, and unlock new areas while navigating famous locations from the show.

Released back in 2003, SpongeBob SquarePants: Battle for Bikini Bottom is one of the most popular SpongeBob games ever. It takes players back to the underwater world where Bikini Bottom is under siege by a robot army created by Plankton, and it’s up to SpongeBob, Patrick, and Sandy to take them down. It’s not the most difficult game in the world by any stretch of the imagination, but it’s one of the hardest SpongeBob games.

Released since the early 2000s, the game remains one of the best SpongeBob games ever, thanks to its humor, characters, and world. Fans can still enjoy the remake Battle for Bikini Bottom – Rehydrated , which polished the graphics and brought the classic experience to modern systems while keeping the core adventure intact.

Nicktoons: Battle for Volcano Island

Multiple Nicktoons Heroes Battle Mawgu

  • The first full sequel to Nicktoons Unite!, where heroes must stop a strange ancient force called the Mawgu.
  • Players explore the vivid world of Volcano Island while preventing a multiverse-threatening crisis.

In Nicktoons: Battle for Volcano Island , the gang returns stronger than before. This one dives into an original threat: the Mawgu, an ancient creature filled with rage and an eerie ooze that twists the world around it. Your heroes, including SpongeBob, Danny Phantom, Timmy Turner, Sandy, and others, find themselves on a mysterious island after being summoned to deal with this looming menace. Across stages filled with monsters and strange environments, they must gather parts for a device that can close a dangerous rift threatening the safety of several worlds, including their own.

The game builds on the crossover idea with more playable characters and dynamic challenges. It wasn’t perfect, but it remains memorable for fans who grew up exploring volcano fields and teaming up across different Nickelodeon universes.

SpongeBob SquarePants: Creature from the Krusty Krab

Weird and Creative SpongeBob Adventure Built Around Dreams

  • The game mixes platforming, racing, flying, and action through dream worlds.
  • SpongeBob platform adventure that follows bizarre dream sequences featuring SpongeBob, Patrick, and Plankton.

This one switches up the usual SpongeBob formula in a wild way. Instead of a straight story set in Bikini Bottom, Creature from the Krusty Krab puts players into weird dream sequences where anything can happen. SpongeBob, Patrick, and even Plankton fall into dream worlds that take them into wild adventures, from hot-rod races and space missions to giant burger battles.

A pretty cool thing about SpongeBob SquarePants: Creature from the Krusty Krab is that racing levels, flying sections, beat-’em-ups, and platforming all mix together to keep things unpredictable. Because each character is living a dream, the scenarios lean into surreal, imaginative fun that feels straight out of cartoon mayhem.

Nicktoons: Attack of the Toybots

Team-Up to Stop an Army of Evil Toy Clones

  • A crossover where villains create mechanical toy duplicates of heroes.
  • Travel through dozens of locations to stop an army of Toybots.

Nicktoons: Attack of the Toybots builds on the crossover world created by Nicktoons Unite! and earlier sequels. In this game, the villain Professor Calamitous develops a strange plan that involves capturing characters and creating evil Toybots, which are mechanical versions of Nickelodeon heroes that run wild across many worlds. What makes this game different from others in the series is the way players switch between characters and styles during missions. Some levels allow up to two heroes at once, while others let players pilot mech suits designed by Jimmy Neutron to battle tougher enemies.

Players visit classic locations, from the oceans of Bikini Bottom to the busy streets of Amity Park, each filled with hazards, puzzles, and robotic foes. Part of the fun comes from discovering which characters suit specific challenges best and figuring out how to complete objectives using their unique skills.

The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron Boy Genius: Attack of the Twonkies

When Jimmy’s Cute Alien Pets Turn Into a Big Problem

  • 3D platform adventure where Jimmy must stop Twonkies that turn destructive when exposed to Earth TV signals.
  • Players explore Retroville and beyond, using gadgets, vehicles, and Jimmy’s inventions to solve problems and defeat enemies.

In Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius – Attack of the Twonkies , a small mistake turns into a big problem. During a space trip, Jimmy discovers tiny alien creatures and brings them back to Earth. At first, the Twonkies seem friendly and harmless. However, once they are exposed to television signals, their behavior changes. They become aggressive and begin causing trouble all over Retroville. Jimmy must now fix the situation before his hometown is completely overrun.

Players guide Jimmy through different areas, collecting items, avoiding hazards, and solving light puzzles. His inventions play a big role. Gadgets help him open paths, disable obstacles, or defeat aggressive Twonkies. The game also mixes things up with vehicle sections, including rocket and hovercraft segments that add variety to the adventure. Locations in The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron Boy Genius: Attack of the Twonkies are inspired by the show, especially Retroville, which gives fans a strong sense of familiarity. Characters from the series appear throughout the story, and the tone stays close to the cartoon’s mix of science humor and chaotic situations.

Rugrats In Paris: The Movie

Explore Paris With the Rugrats

  • A series of mini-games that follow key moments from the Rugrats in Paris movie.
  • Players control the babies as they explore Paris locations and complete simple challenges.

Rugrats in Paris: The Movie follows the story of the movie while turning its key moments into short, playful challenges. Tommy, Chuckie, Phil, Lil, and the other characters travel to Paris, where their everyday adventures turn into big missions through their imagination. The game focuses on important scenes from the movie, especially the Reptarland theme park and other locations around the city.

Subscribe to the newsletter for Nickelodeon game nostalgia

Get deeper dives—subscribe to the newsletter for detailed looks at Nickelodeon game nostalgia, character crossovers, favorite levels, and the memories they spark. Ideal for fans wanting curated retro gaming stories.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Instead of one long storyline, the experience is divided into mini-games. Each activity is short and easy to understand. Some involve platforming and collecting items while others focus on timing, movement, or small puzzles. Every challenge connects to a moment from the movie, allowing players to relive the story in a hands-on way.

Nicktoons Racing

Kart Racer Packed With Classic Nickelodeon Characters

  • A kart racing game where Nickelodeon characters compete across themed tracks.
  • Players collect power-ups, boost their speed, and race to the finish line.

Nicktoons Racing brings together characters from several popular Nickelodeon cartoons and drops them into fast-paced kart races. Players can choose racers from series such as Rugrats, SpongeBob SquarePants, and The Wild Thornberrys. Each character drives a unique vehicle designed to match their world.

Players compete in races, drift around corners, and collect items scattered along the track. These power-ups can increase speed, create obstacles, or slow down opponents, adding a fun layer of competition to every race. At the time of release, crossover games featuring multiple Nickelodeon series were rare. Seeing favorite Nickelodeon characters compete together made the game feel special.

SpongeBob SquarePants: Lights, Camera, Pants!

Party Game That Turns Bikini Bottom Into a Movie Audition

  • Characters compete in mini-games to earn roles in a movie.
  • Allows up to four players compete locally.

In SpongeBob SquarePants: Lights, Camera, Pants! , Bikini Bottom is preparing to film a big movie, and everyone wants a part. Players choose characters like SpongeBob, Patrick, Sandy, and others, then compete in a series of challenges to become the most popular performer and win the best roles. The game is built around mini-games rather than a long story. Each challenge is short and focused, testing timing, movement, or quick reactions. Winning events earn popularity points, which determine how successful a character’s movie career becomes.

Up to four players can compete, making it a strong choice for group play. The simple controls allow anyone to join quickly, whether they are experienced with games or not. The locations, music, and characters all come directly from the cartoon, giving the experience a lively and familiar feel. For many players, the real nostalgia comes from the social side, as players compete with friends while enjoying the humor and energy of Bikini Bottom.

item.title: RedOctane Announces Stage Tour, A Brand-New Music Game With Serious Guitar Hero Vibes
item.description:
Publisher RedOctane Games LLC has just revealed Stage Tour , the latest spiritual successor to the Guitar Hero series. Once a staple in households in the mid-to-late 2000s, Guitar Hero was a rhythm game in which players used instrument peripherals to play along to rock music. At the height of its popularity, Guitar Hero was a cultural phenomenon, with its third title, 2007’s Guitar Hero 3: Legends of Rock , becoming the first video game to earn over $1 billion in revenue.

Just as quickly as the franchise grew in popularity, though, it fell, as market over-saturation of rhythm games between the competing Guitar Hero and Rock Band franchises in 2009 led to the franchise’s cancellation in 2011. Publisher Activision attempted to revive the franchise in 2015 with Guitar Hero Live , but it was a financial failure that led to its developer, FreeStyleGames, being acquired by Ubisoft in 2017. Since then, the franchise has been on ice, although fan projects such as Clone Hero and Yet Another Rhythm Game have earned noteworthy cult followings.

Stage Tour Revealed as Spiritual Successor to Guitar Hero

As part of IGN Fan Fest 2026, RedOctane has showcased the reveal trailer for its newest rhythm game, Stage Tour . While the trailer showcases very little of the game, the gameplay appears very similar to what players experienced in Guitar Hero : five colored notes come down a fretboard known as a “highway,” and players strum along to the notes in time with the music. Up to four players can play at a time, with options for guitar, groove/bass, drums, and vocals. The trailer also showcased the new guitar peripheral, a Gibson Kramer guitar with the same red-and-white color scheme as the guitar controller bundled with Guitar Hero 5 in 2009.

Along with the trailer, RedOctane revealed more details about Stage Tour , emphasizing its standing as a “love letter to rhythm gaming.” The studio intends to deliver “a shot of nostalgia” while keeping the gameplay fresh and modern for a new audience, while making the game approachable for newcomers and challenging for experienced players. RedOctane will reveal more details over the next few months and will prepare a closed Alpha test over the Summer before targeting a Holiday 2026 release window.

The announcement of Stage Tour as a spiritual revival of the Guitar Hero series is certainly an exciting proposition, though it will need more time to make an impression. Across both the Rock Band and Clone Hero subreddits, along with the YouTube comments of the official reveal trailer, fans have expressed concern over the cartoon art style and stiff character animations. It’s worth noting that this is likely an early development build, and there’s likely a lot of polishing to be done to help it live up to its spiritual predecessor.

Still, Stage Tour is a game to keep an eye on over the rest of the year. The return of a Guitar Hero -like rhythm game is welcome, and the knowledge that former Vicarious Visions and RedOctane developers, who previously handled Guitar Hero , are at the forefront of this new project inspires a lot of confidence in the finished product. Clone Hero has already proven to be a fantastic game for hardcore fans, so here’s hoping Stage Tour can stand tall and help bring peripheral-based rhythm gaming back into the mainstream.

item.title: Marathon - Official Server Slam Release Trailer
item.description: Bungie's Marathon opens up its Server Slam, giving players an open preview weekend set to run through March 2, 2026. Marathon's official release is scheduled for March 5, 2026, on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC via Steam.

item.title: LEGO Fan Builds Custom Cubone and Here's How You Can Build It, Too
item.description:
A creative LEGO fan has built a custom Cubone set based on the Pokemon games, and the public can too. LEGO and creativity almost always go hand in hand, and the dedicated community proves this through their consistent custom sets. This dedication has seen everything from transforming Lightning McQueen into a Millennium Falcon to recreating iconic horror scenes through LEGO animation. When this is paired with the sheer passion and love most Nintendo fans give the company's various franchises, it is inevitable that some masterpieces could be created. An example of these creative communities is the Pokemon fans, who always seem to be thinking up some new way of keeping the series interesting.

Historically, LEGO and Pokemon had never officially crossed paths, a fact that was changed upon the announcement of Pokemon 's first LEGO sets in 2026. Despite the hype around this major news, various fans labeled the price tags as a huge issue for these sets, and with the latest Pokemon set being one you can only buy with LEGO Insider points, some fans are still far from their dream LEGO situation. Thankfully, a talented Pokemon and LEGO fan seems to have coincidentally crafted the perfect solution to these issues many fans are facing, at just the right time.

LEGO Fan Builds a Brickheadz Style Cubone Complete With Instructions

Thanks to the Pick a Brick feature on LEGO's website, which allows fans to order individual bricks of their choice, a talented fan has laid out the blueprint for a Brickheadz-inspired LEGO Cubone build. The set was posted by Reddit user StoneWarsDE on the LEGO subreddit and is made up of only 26 pieces that would cost around $4.55, not including shipping fees. To aid fans in building this, the user also attached their own custom instructions, allowing for an easy and visually pleasing build. This small and sleek build proves a great short-term alternative to the official sets, especially given that scalpers are making the Pokemon sets go for ridiculous prices on eBay. It's unclear if the user has any plans to produce more Pokemon -inspired sets, although given that fans are expressing praise for the Cubone build, it wouldn't be unlikely.

While not the most popular Pokemon, Cubone seems to have a knack for inspiring creativity, with another Pokemon fan creating a Cubone rug. Perhaps the tragic backstory seen in the anime series, involving the skull Cubone wears, belonging to their mother who passed away, evoked an emotional reaction for many fans. Fans have already begun leaving their suggestions for which Pokemon that StoneWarsDE should build next, with one user joking that it should be all 150 of the original generation. The mask is arguably the most interesting aspect of this LEGO Cubone, using a mask from a Ninjago set that somehow maintains the aesthetic and proves the versatility of LEGO.

The creation of not only this amazing custom Cubone build, but also the various sets that fans transform into other iconic pieces of pop culture, creates a discussion on the current price of LEGO. Another builder's idea of transforming the LEGO Bonsai Tree set into Zelda 's Deku Tree left fans asking for instructions, simply due to the high price tag on the official LEGO Deku Tree set. Despite the clear high quality of LEGO, the various uses it has, and the bundles of entertainment it can bring, even some of the most devout LEGO fans seem to agree that certain prices may be a bit too high. With the most expensive of Pokemon 's new LEGO sets retailing for $649.99, this Brickheadz-inspired custom Cubone build can act as a cheap yet stunning addition to any Pokemon fan's collection, and further proof of the LEGO community's creativity.
